titleStmt.title: Primitive Christianity continued in the faith and practice of the people called Quakers being in answer to a pamphlet entituled, Primitive heresie &c. and which may serve as an appendix to a book entituled, An antidote against the venom of the snake in the grass, by George Whitehead / Joseph Wyeth.
titleStmt.author: Wyeth, Joseph, 1663-1731.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed and sold by T. Sowle,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the Harvard University Library.
